_source.age_criteria:
Minimum age: 18.0 Years
Maximum age: 999.0 Years
_source.description: This phase II trial studies how well single-photon emission computed tomography (SPECT) and computed tomography (CT) work in predicting TheraSphere (yttrium Y 90 glass microspheres) dose distribution in patients with liver cancer. SPECT is a type of CT scan in which a small amount of a radioactive drug is injected into a vein and a scanner is used to make detailed images of areas inside the body where the radioactive material is taken up by the cells. CT scan is a procedure that uses a computer linked to an x-ray machine to make a series of detailed pictures of areas inside the body. Comparing results of diagnostic procedures done before and after yttrium Y 90 glass microspheres treatment may help doctors predict a patient's response to the treatment.

eligibility_criteria.description: Scheduled for radioembolization with TheraSphere before noon (to allow for imaging post-therapy)
Must not be enrolled in another clinical study
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-2
At least 2 months interval from prior conventional transarterial chemoembolization (cTACE) (conventional TACE) or DEB-TACE (doxorubicin [doxorubicin hydrochloride] eluting bead TACE)

Unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma patients with liver-predominant disease, or patients with hepatocellular carcinoma who refuse surgery; multifocal hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) is acceptable, no diffuse HCC

A wash-out period interval from prior anti-angiogenic systemic therapy of at least double the half life of the anti-angiogenic agent (e.g., 4 days wash-out for sorafenib; 1 month wash-out for bevacizumab)

groups.description: Patients undergo Tc-99m MAA SPECT and dual-phase CBCT at baseline. Patients then undergo radioembolization with yttrium Y 90 glass microspheres. After treatment and no later than 24 hours, patients undergo Bremsstrahlung SPECT/CT and Y-90 PET/CT.

outcome_measures.analysis_method: The tumor mean absorbed dose will be computed. A generalized linear model (GLM) for repeated measures will be fitted. Will estimate μ and its 95% confidence interval.

outcome_measures.analysis_method: Pre-therapy dose will be observed using segmented MAA image, voxelized MAA image, segmented CBCT image, voxelized CBCT image, combination of segmented CBCT image (to specify edges) and segmented MAA image. The post-therapy dose distribution will be determined by averaging its corresponding values from Bremsstrahlung SPECT/CT image and Y-90 PET/CT image.

_source.public_title: Single-Photon Emission Computed Tomography and Positron Emission Tomography in Predicting TheraSphere Dose Distribution in Patients with Liver Cancer
_source.scientific_description:
PRIAMRY OBJECTIVES:
I. To validate methods for performing pre-therapy (TheraSphere [yttrium Y 90 glass microspheres]) dosimetry using quantitative technetium Tc 99m-labeled macroaggregated albumin (Tc-99m MAA) SPECT and C-Arm CT imaging.

SECONDARY OBJECTIVES:
I. To utilize the dosimetry obtained from the TheraSphere imaging to estimate the current range of normal liver doses.
II. To validate predictions of the equivalent uniform dose (EUD), tumor control probability (TCP), biologically effective dose (BED) distribution, and normal tissue complication probability (NTCP).

OUTLINE:
Patients undergo Tc-99m MAA SPECT and dual-phase cone-beam CT (CBCT) at baseline. Patients then undergo radioembolization with yttrium Y 90 glass microspheres. After treatment and no later than 24 hours, patients undergo Bremsstrahlung SPECT/CT and Y-90 PET/CT.

After completion of study, patients are followed up at 1 month.
_source.title: Validation of Dose Estimation Methods and Measurement of Normal Liver Dose in Y-90 Therasphere Therapy with Quantitative Nuclear Imaging
